amendment.description: Amendment provides that nothing in the bill is intended to affect the ability of the Department of Labor to issue advisory opinions, information letters, technical releases, prohibited transactions, exemptions, or other pronouncements interpreting and applying ERISA's fiduciary responsibility rules to particular factual situations, or exempting specific transactions from the prohibited transaction provisions of ERISA.
amendment.purpose: An amendment stating that nothing in this Act is intended to affect the ability of the Department of Labor to issue advisory opinions, information, letters, technical releases, or other pronouncements interpreting and applying ERISA's fiduciary special responsibility rules.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Traficant amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.
